300-level live demo ); | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | :--- | :--- | | **Scenario overview** | This demo shows the integration of prediction services inside rules-based decisions and how Cloud Pak for Business Automation leverages intelligent decisions to deliver rapidly new applications. This scenario is not willing to explain in detail what rules are, and it is not in the scope of the scenario to go deep inside Automation Decision Services's rule management capabilities. The focus of the demo is really around the artificial intelligence (AI)/machine learning (ML) native integration. It is also in the scope of this demo to show the power of Cloud Pak for Business Automation to create low-code interfaces from where Automation Decision Services will be consumed and valorized.

This demo is 100% based on IBM technology:
1. Watson Machine Learning
2. Cloud Pak for Business Automation | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Business Automation V21.0.1, Cloud Pak for Data and AI | | **Demo capabilities** | Business Rule Automation, Predictive Services Integration, Rapid Application Development | | **Demo guidance** | This demo script has multiple tasks, that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see (**Screenshots**). This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo use case. | **INSTALL THE DEMO**
Demo installation files
Before proceeding with the steps below, please download the following files:
• [Customer churn logs](./SkyTalk_customer_churn_logs.csv)
• [Customer LTV logs](./SkyTalk_customer_LTV_logs.csv)
• Retention policy
• [SkyTalk call center application](./SkyTalk_call_center_application.twx)
• [SkyTalk retention decision service](./SkyTalk-retention-DS.zip)

These files will be referenced in the steps below.

**PREPARE TO GIVE THE DEMO** The setup process is illustrated in the following chart. Each number icon corresponds to the respective preparation step below.
![Demo Setup Process](./images/0-demo-installation-process.png) ### 1 - Provision your demo environment You must install Cloud Pak for Business Automation 21.0.1 or provision a ROKS environment that will be available for 2 weeks at no charge.
The steps below explain how to get a free pre-configured Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment:
Reserve your CP4BA preconfigured environment on ROKS
1. Log in to the IBM Technology Zone using your IBM ID. Then, click on the **Activation Kits** tab.

![TechZone](./images/1-Techzone_600.png)

2. Scroll down to click on the **Cloud Pak for Business Automation** tile.

![CP4BA Activation Kit](./images/1-CP4BA_Activation_Kit_600.png)

3. Click on the **Environments - Reserve Here!** tab. Then, select the **Reserve Here! - Cloud Pak for Business Automation OpenShift Demo Environments** tile.

4. Click on the **Preinstalled OpenShift Environments** tab. Then, select the latest version of the **Preinstalled Cloud Pak for Business Automation on Red Hat OpenShift on IBM Cloud**.

5. Select **Reserve now**. Then, after entering the **Purpose**, **Preferred Geography**, and **Notes**, click on **Submit**.

6. When you are done, you will see a confirmation message. In addition, you will receive a confirmation email with all the access links.

![Confirmation](./images/1-Confirmation_600.png)

![Confirmation Email](./images/1-Confirmation_email_600.png)

7. Then, you will receive an email confirming that your instance is provisioned. It may take 30 to 45 minutes.

![Instance Provisioned](./images/1-Ready_email_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Access your provisioned Cloud Pak for Business Automation environment
1. Log in to the IBM Technology Zone.

2. At the top right corner, click on the **Profile** icon. Then, click on **Reservations**. You will then be directed to the **My reservations** page, in which you can see your reservation details. Note: Bookmark this page for ease of reference.

![Reservations](./images/2-Reservations_600.png)

![My Reservations](./images/2-My_Reservations_600.png)

3. Once it's provisioned, your instance should look like the screenshot below.

![Provisioned Instance](./images/2-Provisioned_Instance_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Access your OpenShift instance
When your instance is provisioned, you should receive a confirmation email with the access links. If the links are not attached to the email, please refer to the steps below.

1. Go to the START HERE section in your OpenShift Instance. Note: The link is also provided in the confirmation email.

![IBM Technology Zone](./images/3-Start_Here_600.png)

2. Click to open the **README.md** file, and scroll down to click on **Preinstalled Cluster**. Under **Instructions**, click on **2 - Wait for your cluster** to expand the section and follow step 2.2.

3. From your **Reservation** page, double-click on your instance, and copy your **Environment ID**.

![Environment ID](./images/3-EnvironmentID_600.png)

4. Log in to your IBM Cloud account.

5. On the top menu, swap to the **DTESQUAD** account.

![DTESQUAD](./images/3-DTE_Squad_600.png)

6. From the **Clusters** menu, search for your cluster using the **Environment ID** that was copied from step 3.

![Clusters](./images/3-Cluster_Menu_600.png)

7. Check that your cluster's state is green, and double-click on it. Check that your **Ingress subdomain** is set up, and open your **OpenShift web console**.

8. Open the **Workloads** menu, and select **Config Maps**. Then, set your project to **dtecp4ba**.

9. Search for **access** to access the **icp4Adeploy-cp4ba-access-info** file. Open this file to access all your access links and credentials to the various environments. Note: You have the **ADS-runtime-access-info** in that file as well.

![Access](./images/3-Access_600.png)

10. The important link is the **BAStudio URL**. From this URL, you will be able to access the key elements of the demo:
• Business Automation Studio
• Application Designer
• Automation Decision Services

11. You are now ready to set up the demo. Open **BAStudio** from the Automation Decision Services link in the access file.

**[Go to top](#top)**
### 2 - IBM Watson Studio setup
Set up your IBM Watson Studio account
1. Click here to log in to your IBM Cloud account, or create a new one.

2. Click on **Catalog** at the top, and type **Watson Studio** in the search menu. Then, select **Watson Studio Lite**.

![Watson Studio](./images/2-1-Watson_Studio_600.png)

![Watson Studio Lite](./images/2-1-Watson_Studio_Lite_600.png)

3. Select a location for your service. Select the **Lite** plan (free), and click **Create**.

4. Once it's provisioned, click on **Get Started**.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Create your deployment space
1. Click on **New deployment space**.

![Get Started](./images/2-1-Get_Started_600.png)

2. Give a name to your deployment space (e.g., SkyTalk production space).

3. Create your **Cloud Object Storage** service.
a. Go in the **Select object service** section, and click **Create**.
b. Select the **Lite** version, and click **Create**.

4. Select your machine learning service.
a. Go in the **Select machine learning service (optional)** section, and click **Create**. Then, select your location.
b. Select the **Lite** version, and click **Create**.
c. Click on **Select a machine learning service**, and scroll to select your newly created machine learning service.
d. Click on **Create** (bottom right of the screen), and let the deployment space creation run.
e. Once it's done, you should see a **The space is ready** message. Click on **View new space** to see your new deployment space.

![Preparing Space](./images/2-2-Space_Preparing_600.png)

![Space Ready](./images/2-2-Space_Ready_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Check the services installed
1. Click on the **Menu** icon (top left corner).

![Space](./images/2-2-View_Space_600.png)

2. Click on **Services**, and then select **Service instances**.

![Services](./images/2-3-Services_600.png)

3. You should now see your three newly created services.

![Service Instances](./images/2-3-Service_Instances_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Create a new project
1. Click on **IBM Watson Studio**, and then click on **New project**.

2. Select **Create an empty project**, and enter details for your project. Once it's created, you'll have an empty project.

3. Click on **Add to project** and add the **AutoAI experiment**.

![Empty Project](./images/2-4-Empty_Project_600.png)

![Choose Asset Type](./images/2-4-Add_AutoAI_600.png)

4. Enter a name for your experiment. Example: LOT-Customer retention demo experiment

5. Click on **Associate a Machine Learning service instance**.

6. Select your machine learning service instance, and click on **Associate service** in the blue ribbon.

![Associate service](./images/2-4-Associate_Service_600.png)

7. In the AutoAI configuration menu, click on **Reload**. Your machine learning service should now show up.

8. At the bottom right corner, click on **Create** to create your machine learning experiment in Watson Studio. Once it's completed, your AutoAI experiment is ready to be set up.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Set up the churn service
1. Under **Add data sources**, click on **Browse**.

![Project](./images/2-4-Project_Ready_600.png)

2. Select the **SkyTalk_customer_churn_logs.csv** file. Note: This data file was already downloaded as one of the [demo installation files](#install-the-demo).

![Select File](./images/2-5-Select_File_600.png)

3. Select the prediction criteria by following the steps below.

a. Click on **Select prediction column**.

![Prediction Column](./images/2-5-Prediction_Column_600.png)

b. Select **CHURN**.

![Churn](./images/2-5-Churn_600.png)

c. Click on **Run experiment**. Your AutoAI run will begin, and it should take around five minutes. Once it's done, the progress map's status will read **Experiment completed**.

![Run Experiment](./images/2-5-Run_Experiment_600.png)

![Experiment Summary](./images/2-5-Experiment_600.png)

![Experiment Completed](./images/2-5-Experiment_Completed_600.png)

d. Click on the first row in the **Pipeline leaderboard**, and then select **Save as**.

![Pipeline Leaderboard](./images/2-5-Pipeline_600.png)

e. Select **Model**, and click on **Create**. Then, you should see a **Saved model successfully** notification.

![Model Details](./images/2-5-Model_600.png)

f. Return to the project view by clicking on the machine learning experiment in the breadcrumb navigation bar. You should now see your Watson Machine Learning (WML) model listed.

![Navigation Bar](./images/2-5-Breadcrumb_600.png)

![WML](./images/2-5-WML_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Set up the lifetime value (LTV) service
1. Follow the steps below to add the customer lifetime value CSV file to your data assets.

a. Click on **New Data asset**, and select **browse**.

![Project View](./images/2-5-WML_600.png)

b. Select the **SkyTalk_customer_LTV_logs.csv** file. Note: This data file was already downloaded as one of the [demo installation files](#install-the-demo).

![Select File](./images/2-6-Select_File_600.png)

c. The file should now appear in your list under **Data assets**.

![Data Assets](./images/2-6-Data_Assets_600.png)

2. Follow the steps below to create a new AutoAI experiment.

a. Click on **New AutoAI experiment**, and enter details for your experiment. Make sure the machine learning service is associated to your experiment. Then, click **Create**.

![New AutoAI Experiment](./images/2-6-New_AutoAI_600.png)

b. Under **Add data sources**, click on **Select from project**. Select the **SkyTalk_customer_LTV_logs.csv** file, and click on **Select Asset**.

![Add Data Sources](./images/2-6-Add_Data-Sources_600.png)

![Select Data Asset](./images/2-6-Select_Data_Asset_600.png)

c. Under the **What do you want to predict?** section, select **LTV**.

![LTV](./images/2-6-LTV_600.png)

d. Click on **Run experiment**. The experiment should last around five minutes. Once it's done, the progress map's status will read **Experiment completed**.

![Run Experiment](./images/2-6-Run_Experiment_600.png)

![Experiment Completed](./images/2-6-Experiment_Completed_600.png)

e. Click on the first row in the **Pipeline leaderboard**. It is marked with a black star on the left column. Then, click **Save as**.

![Pipeline Leaderboard](./images/2-6-Pipeline_Leaderboard_600.png)

f. Select **Model**, and click on **Create**. Then, you should see a **Saved model successfully** notification.

![Model Details](./images/2-6-Model_600.png)

g. Click on the project to return to the project view. You should now see that the model has been created and listed.

![Navigation Bar](./images/2-6-Breadcrumb_600.png)

![WML](./images/2-6-WML_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Deploy the lifetime value service
#### Deploy the models in the deployment environment Your free quota will be consumed as long as the models are deployed.
Deploy the models before the demonstration, and undeploy them as soon as the demo is done to not be overcharged and to save your free monthly quota.

1. Select the LTV model, and click on the **ellipsis** icon. Then, click on **Promote**.

![LTV Model Menu](./images/2-7-Promote_600.png)

2. Select your deployment space that was previously created. Click on **Promote**.

![Deployment Space](./images/2-7-Deployment_Space_600.png)

3. Repeat steps 1 and 2 with the customer churn model.

4. Click on **IBM Watson Studio** (top left corner). Select **Deployments** and then **View all spaces**.

![IBM Watson Studio](./images/2-7-IBM_Watson_Studio_600.png)

5. Select the **Spaces** tab, and click on your deployment space.

![Spaces](./images/2-7-Spaces_600.png)

6. In the **Assets** tab, you should see your two models that are ready to be executed.

![Assets](./images/2-7-Assets_600.png)

7. At this point, nothing is deployed yet. You will be charged as soon as you execute the models. If you click on the **Deployments** tab, there should be no deployments to monitor.

![Deployments](./images/2-7-Deployments_600.png)

8. In the **Assets** tab, select the LTV model and click on the **rocket** icon to start the service.

![Deploy](./images/2-7-Deploy_600.png)

9. Give a name to the deployment, and click **Create**. When it's deployed, you should see the deployment message.

![Create Deployment](./images/2-7-Create_Deployment_600.png)

10. Repeat steps 6 to 10 for the customer churn model.

11. Click on the **Deployments** tab to see the services that are deployed. You will be charged until you undeploy the services after the demonstration.

![Services Deployed](./images/2-7-Services_Deployed_600.png)

12. Get the Deployment ID to configure Automation Decision Services. In the **Deployments** list, click on **Churn Service**. Then, copy the **Deployment ID**. Repeat this step to get the **Deployment ID** for the lifetime value service as well.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Undeploy the service after the demo
1. Start IBM Watson Studio from your IBM Cloud account.

2. Go in your deployment workspace to see that your two services are up and running.

![Services Deployed](./images/2-8-Services_Deployed_600.png)

3. Select the **Churn Service**. Then, click on the **ellipsis** icon, and select **Delete**. Repeat this step for the **LTV Service**.

4. In the **Deployments** tab, you should see that there are no deployments to monitor. Note: From now, your quota is not consumed anymore.

![Deployments](./images/2-8-Deployments_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
### 3 - Get your credentials
The Automation Decision Services Watson Machine Learning provider
During your first installation, you will have to set up your machine learning provider. To do so, refer to [5 - Connect your machine learning services to your Automation Decision Services project](#prep-5). Note: You need to set up the machine learning provider only once.

The machine learning provider needs the following information to connect to your IBM Watson Studio deployment workspace:

![New Provider](./images/3-1-New_Provider_600.png)

The steps below will help you find these different elements:
• API key
• Space ID
• URL

**[Go to top](#top)**
Recover the API key
The API key provides your personal credentials and allows an external application to connect to your deployment workspace in IBM Watson Studio.

If you already have an API key, you can reuse it. Otherwise, you will need a new one. To get a new API key, please follow the steps below.

1. Connect to your IBM Cloud instance.

2. Click on the **Manage** menu, and select **Access (IAM)**.

![Manage Menu](./images/3-2-Manage_Menu_600.png)

3. Select **API keys**.

![API Keys](./images/3-2-API_Keys_600.png)

4. Click on **Create an IBM Cloud API Key**.

![Create an IBM Cloud API key](./images/3-2-Create_API_Key_600.png)

5. Enter a name and description for the API key. Then, click on **Create**.

![Create](./images/3-2-Create_600.png)

6. You can unmask the API key to view it. This API key is required for your machine learning provider setup. You can directly copy it to your clipboard or download the API key locally and keep it for other uses.

![Success](./images/3-2-Success_600.png)

![View API Key](./images/3-2-View_API_Key_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Get the Space ID
1. Open your IBM Cloud account.

2. Click on the **Resource list** icon (left hand corner), and double-click on your Watson Studio instance. Then, click **Get Started**.

![Services and Software](./images/3-3-Services_Software_600.png)

![Watson Studio](./images/3-3-Watson_Studio_600.png)

3. Click on the deployment workspace, and select the **Manage** tab.

![Manage](./images/3-3-Manage_600.png)

4. In that tab, you will see your **Space ID** in the **Space GUID** field. Copy your **Space ID** and paste it in the **Space ID** field of your machine learning provider's setup view. ![Space ID](./images/3-3-SpaceID_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Find the URL
The URL is the deployment URL of your workspace. Your two machine learning services must be deployed to retrieve the URL. If not, review [2 - IBM Watson Studio setup](#prep-2) to deploy them.

1. From your IBM Watson Studio instance, go to your deployment space.

![IBM Watson Studio](./images/3-4-Watson_Studio_600.png)

2. Select the **Deployments** tab, and open one of the deployed models.

![Deployments](./images/3-4-Deployments_600.png)

![Deployed Model](./images/3-4-Deployed_Model_600.png)

3. Under **Direct link**, the URL is the portion that is highlighted below.

![URL](./images/3-4-URL_600.png)

4. Copy and paste this URL in the URL field of the machine learning provider setup, and you are all set to test your machine learning provider connection in .

Note: Don't forget to undeploy the models if you are not using them for a demo to avoid being overcharged.

**[Go to top](#top)**
### 4 - Set up the decision service in Automation Decision Services
Start Automation Decision Services
1. Open your OpenShift console from IBM Cloud.

2. Click on **Clusters**, and double-click on your cluster. If you have several clusters, recover your cluster ID from the **My reservations** page in IBM Technology Zone.

![Clusters](./images/4-1-Clusters_600.png)

![Cluster](./images/4-1-Cluster_600.png)

3. Click on **OpenShift web console** to open it.

![OpenShift Web Console](./images/4-1-OpenShift_Web_Console_600.png)

4. Open **Workloads** on the menu bar, and click on **Config Maps**.

![Menu](./images/4-1-Workloads_600.png)

5. Search for **access**, and open the **icp4adeploy-cp4ba-access-inf** file.

![Access](./images/4-1-Access_600.png)

6. Under **ADS-designer-access-info**, you'll find the URL and login credentials to access Automation Decision Services. Copy and paste the URL in your browser (Chrome/Firefox), and log in using the credentials.

7. On the menu bar, click on **Business automations** under **Design**.

![Menu](./images/4-1-Business_Automations_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Import your decision model
1. Under **Business automations**, click on **Create**. Then, select **Decision automations**.

![Business Automations](./images/4-2-Business_Automations_600.png)

2. Provide a name to your decision automation: **Telco retention decision service**. Then, click **Create**. Accept all the privacy checks and close the guide tour views if you encounter any.

3. Click on **Import**, and import your **SkyTalk-retention-DS.zip** file. Note: This data file was already downloaded as one of the [demo installation files](#install-the-demo).

![Import](./images/4-2-Import_600.png)

4. You should now see the Telco retention decision service. ![Telco](./images/4-2-DS_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
### 5 - Connect your machine learning services to your Automation Decision Services project
Get your machine learning deployment ID
Refer to [2 - IBM Watson Studio setup](#prep-2) (**Deploy the LTV service** section), and get the deployment IDs for your two machine learning models.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Configure the machine learning provider in your Automation Decision Services project
1. Open **Automation Studio** from your provisioned environment.

2. Open your decision project by double-clicking on the tile.

![Decision](./images/5-2-Business_Automations_600.png)

3. Click on the **ellipsis** icon next to the service name, and select **Settings**.

![Settings](./images/5-2-Settings_600.png)

4. Select **Machine learning providers**, and click on **New**.

![ML Providers](./images/5-2-ML_Providers_600.png)

5. Select **Watson ML** as the provider type. Enter your API Key that was saved from IBM Watson Studio (refer to [3 - Get your credentials](#prep-3)). ![New Provider](./images/5-2-New_Provider_600.png)

6. Enter the **Space ID** for your deployment space.

![Deployment Space](./images/5-2-Space_600.png)

7. Enter the **Service URL** found in your deployed artifact.

![Service](./images/5-2-Service_600.png)

8. Test the connection. When it's done, click **Save**. your machine learning provider is now configured.

![Configured](./images/5-2-Configured_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Connect your machine learning decision model to your deployed instances
1. Select your decision service.

![Decision Service](./images/5-3-DS_600.png)

2. In the **Predictive models** tab, select the **Customer Churn** model.

![Predictive Models](./images/5-3-Predictive_Models_600.png)

3. The status of the machine learning provider should read: **Not connected**. Click on **Connect**.

![ML Provider](./images/5-3-ML_Provider_600.png)

4. Select your **Machine learning provider**.

![Select Provider](./images/5-3-Select_Provider_600.png)

5. Select the deployed service to connect to. Click **Next** twice, and then click **Run**.

![Select Deployed Service](./images/5-3-Select_Deployed_Service_600.png)

![Run](./images/5-3-Run_600.png)

6. A **Test succeeded** notification should display.

![Success](./images/5-3-Success_600.png)

7. Click on **Next**, and then click on **Generate from test output**. Click on **OK**, and then select **Apply**. Your service is now connected to the churn prediction machine learning service.

![Generate from Test Output](./images/5-3-Generate_600.png)

![Output](./images/5-3-Output_600.png)

8. Repeat steps 2 to 7 to connect the lifetime value service.

**[Go to top](#top)**
Test your service
1. In the **Telco retention DS** project, select **Retention offer**. Select **Run** twice.

![Telco](./images/5-4-Telco_600.png)

2. Under the **Run** tab, note that your lifetime value and churn services have been invoked.

![Run](./images/5-4-Run_600.png)

3. Select another profile, and click **Run**. Note: Undeploy your machine learning services when the demo is terminated.

![Profile](./images/5-4-Profile_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
### 6 - Deploy and publish your decision service
Deploy the decision service
1. Open Automation Decision Services, and open the **Telco retention decision service**.

![Business Automations](./images/6-1-Business_Automations_600.png)

2. Click on **Share changes** to push the service details in GitHub and share changes (if any).

![Share Changes](./images/6-1-Share_Changes_600.png)

3. Click on the **View history** tab, and click on **Version +** in the first row.

![Version](./images/6-1-Version_+_600.png)

4. Give a name to your version and provide a description. Then, click **Create**.

![Create](./images/6-1-Create_600.png)

5. Click on the **Deploy** tab, and expand your newly created version. Then, click on **Deploy**.

![Deploy](./images/6-1-Deploy_600.png)

6. Click on **Deploy**, and stay on the page.

![Deploy](./images/6-1-Deploy_DS_600.png)

7. After the deployment successfully completes, click on **Business Automations**, and you should now see your new decision service version.

![Decision service](./images/6-1-DS_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Publish the decision service
1. Click on the **ellipsis** icon, and select **Publish**.

![Publish](./images/6-2-Publish_600.png)

2. After a few seconds, you will see the information below.

![Publish](./images/6-2-Info_600.png)

3. Your service is now ready to be used by the SkyTalk call center application.

![Service](./images/6-2-Service_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
### 7 - Install the UI application
Prerequisites
To install the demo's front end interface, make sure that:

1. You have access to Business Automation Studio -- Application Designer.

2. You have deployed your **telco_retention_ds** decision service.

![Decision Service](./images/7-1-DS_600.png)

3. You have the **SkyTalk_call_center_application.twx** project file ready. Note: This data file was already downloaded as one of the [demo installation files](#install-the-demo). **[Go to top](#top)**
Install the demo application
1. Open **Business Automation Studio**, and check that the **telco_retention_ds** service is correctly deployed.

2. On the menu bar, click on **Business automations** under **Design**.

![Business Applications](./images/7-2-Business_Applications_600.png)

3. There should be no deployed applications if you are starting from a newly provisioned ROKS instance.

![Business Applications](./images/7-2-No_Applications_600.png)

4. Click on **Import**, and select the **SkyTalk_call_center_application.twx** project file. Click **OK**, and wait for the **Import successful** message to appear.

![Import](./images/7-2-Import_600.png)

5. **Telco Retention Application** should now appear under **Business applications**.

![Telco](./images/7-2-Telco_600.png)

6. Click on the **Telco Retention Application** tile to view the details.

![Telco](./images/7-2-Telco_Tile_600.png)

7. Select the **Automation services** tab, and check that your application is linked to your deployed automation service.

![Automation Services](./images/7-2-Automation_Services_600.png)

8. To view how the demo is built, click on **Open**. To give a customer demo, click on **Preview**.

![Demo](./images/7-2-Open_Preview_600.png)

9. After a few seconds, the demo panel should appear. Resize it to show the entire screen.

![Demo Panel](./images/7-2-Demo_Panel_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Test the connection
1. You have three predefined customers that you can find by clicking on the **Search customer** help icon.

![Help](./images/7-3-Customers_600.png)

2. Enter **John Smith** in the search text field, and click on the search button.

3. You should see **1 customer found** appear with the customer details prefilled.

A: If you don’t see the Telco retention decision service, it may be due to an incomplete deployment phase. Make sure that you have published your deployed decision service in Automation Decision Services. Refer to the deployment steps in [6 - Deploy and publish your decision service](#prep-6).

**Q: I get an error when I launch the service after a reconnection.**

A: After reconfiguring your service connection, you may have some errors when you invoke your service during the preview. It may be due to some cash authorization access problems. It should work after you clean all of your browser's cache data (including cookies) and restart Application Designer.

**Q: My decision service is deployed but with a different name.**

1. Click on **Open** in your application tile.

2. Click on your user icon image, and open **Preferences**.

3. Select the **Advanced** view mode. Note: You may have to restart after this.

10. Click on **Telco retention** to return to your models.

11. Repeat steps 3 to 9 for **Customer Lifetime Value**.

![LTV](./images/8-2-LTV_600.png)

12. To test the decision service, click on **Telco retention**.

![Telco Retention](./images/8-2-Breadcrumb_600.png)

13. Click on **Retention offer**. Then, click on **Run** three times to test the service.

![Retention Offer](./images/8-2-Retention_600.png)

14. Click on **Run**.

![Retention Offer](./images/8-2-John_600.png)

15. Your machine learning services must return new values. Then, click on **Share changes**.

![Messages](./images/8-2-New_Values_600.png)

16. Click on **View history**, and then click on **Version +** to create a new version of the decision service.

![Deploy](./images/8-2-Deploy_600.png)

18. Click on Business Automation to return to IBM Automation Studio.

19. Click on the decision service tile to see the versions.

20. Publish the new version.

![Publish](./images/8-2-Publish_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**
Reconnect the Telco Retention Application to the new decision service

![Telco Retention Application](./images/8-3-Telco_Retention_App_600.png)

2. Click on the **Diagram** tab, and select the **Call telco_retention...** node.

![Diagram](./images/8-3-Diagram_600.png)

3. Select the **Implementation** tab. Note the name of the actual decision service. Here in this example, it is telco_retention_ds_Service. ![Implementation](./images/8-3-Implementation_600.png)

6. Select the **retentionOffer** operation.

![retentionOffer](./images/8-3-retentionOffer_600.png)

7. In the operation combo, select the **retentionOffer** operation.

![Operation](./images/8-3-Operation_600.png)

8. The data mapping must be redone. Since the new service has the same complex name types, Application Designer has automatically renamed the customer and subscription types by adding "**_1**" to the names of the types.

![Data Mapping](./images/8-3-Data_Mapping_600.png)

9. Click on the icon on the left of the yellow arrow, and select the **customer** variable.

![Icon](./images/8-3-Arrow_600.png)

![Customer](./images/8-3-Customer_600.png)

10. An error will appear due to the renaming.

11. Select the **subscription** variable under **Input Mapping** as well. Another error will appear.

![Subscription](./images/8-3-Subscription_600.png)

![Error](./images/8-3-Input_Mapping_600.png)

12. Under **Output Mapping**, select the **message** and **estimated_cost** variables.

![Mapping](./images/8-3-Output_Mapping_600.png)

13. Let's now solve the variable name change issue. Go in the **Variables** tab, and select the **customer** variable.

![Variable](./images/8-3-Variable_600.png)

14. Click on **Select** in the **Variable type** field, and select the option with the "**_1**" (**customerRecord_1** in our case).

![Select](./images/8-3-Select_600.png)

15. Repeat steps 13 and 14 for the **subscription** variable.

![Select](./images/8-3-Select_Subscription_600.png)

16. Return to the **Diagram** tab, and click on the **Call telco_retention...** node again. Take a look at the **Data Mapping** tab to see that the errors are gone.

![Data Mapping](./images/8-3-Errors_Gone_600.png)

17. We can optionally remove the original decision service that we noted in step 3.

![Optional](./images/8-3-Remove_600.png)

18. Click on **Preview** to test the connection. Selecting **Sarah Miller** must return the result below.

![Preview](./images/8-3-Sarah_Miller_600.png)

1. Log in to the IBM Technology Zone.

![Reservations](./images/2-Reservations_600.png)

**[Go to top](#top)**

![Space](./images/2-2-View_Space_600.png)

Troubleshooting
**Q: I don't see the deployed decision service.**

A: If you don’t see the Telco retention decision service, it may be due to an incomplete deployment phase. Make sure that you have published your deployed decision service in Automation Decision Services. Refer to the deployment steps in [6 - Deploy and publish your decision service](#prep-6).

**Q: I get an error when I launch the service after a reconnection.**

A: After reconfiguring your service connection, you may have some errors when you invoke your service during the preview. It may be due to some cash authorization access problems. It should work after you clean all of your browser's cache data (including cookies) and restart Application Designer.

**Q: My decision service is deployed but with a different name.**

A: You will have to bind the decision node in Application Designer to your deployed service by following the steps below:

1. Click on **Open** in your application tile.

2. Click on your user icon image, and open **Preferences**.

![Preferences](./images/7-4-Preferences_600.png)

3. Select the **Advanced** view mode. Note: You may have to restart after this.

![Advanced](./images/7-4-Advanced_600.png)

4. Click on the **Diagram** tab, in which you should see the application diagram.

![Diagram](./images/7-4-Diagram_600.png)

5. Double-click on the **Call telco_retention_ds** box.

6. Select the **Implementation** tab. Click on **Select**, and select your own decision service. Make sure you also select the **retentionOffer** operation.

![Implementation](./images/7-4-Implementation_600.png)

7. Go in the **Data Mapping** section, and make sure the local variables are linked to your service input/output.

![Data Mapping](./images/7-4-Data_Mapping_600.png)

8. If you have errors, it may be due to the import that caused duplications (ex: CustomerRecord_1). You must then make sure that the variables are from that new class to allow the data mapping.

9. Click on the **Variables** tab, and select the customer (**CustomerRecord**). Select the duplicated type in the **Variable type** section. It should now be customer (CustomerRecord_1) type.

![Variable](./images/7-4-Variable_600.png)

10. Repeat these steps for the subscription class.

11. Return to the **Diagram** view.

12. Reconnect your input and output data to map the new service type. You should now have no errors. Click on **Preview** and test the connection.
